alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Larimer; Lincoln; Logan; Morgan; Phillips; Sedgwick; Washington; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued March 31 at 4:11PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR BLOWING DUST FROM 1100 AM FRIDAY UNTIL 800 PM FRIDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Blowing Dust. WHERE...Sedgwick, Logan, Larimer, Phillips, Weld, Morgan, Yuma, Washington, Elbert, Kit Carson, Lincoln, Cheyenne, Kiowa, Bent, Prowers, Otero, Huerfano, Las Animas, Baca, Crowley and Pueblo Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Julesburg, Sterling, Fort Collins, Holyoke, Greeley, Fort Morgan, Wray, Akron, Kiowa, Burlington, Limon, Cheyenne Wells, Eads, Las Animas, Lamar, La Junta, Walsenburg, Kim, Trinidad, Springfield, Ordway and Pueblo. WHEN...1100 AM Friday March 31 to 800 PM Friday March 31 IMPACTS...Air Quality Health Advisory for Blowing Dust Issued for the eastern plains of Colorado and the San Luis Valley Issued at 9 AM MDT, Friday, March 31st, 2023 Issued by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment Affected Area: Larimer, Weld, Logan, Sedgwick, Phillips, Morgan, Washington, Yuma, Elbert, Lincoln, Kit Carson, Cheyenne, Kiowa, Prowers, Otero, Baca, Bent, Huerfano, Crowley, Las Animas, eastern Pueblo and Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to Fort Morgan, Julesburg, Holyoke, Wray, Akron, Lamar, Limon, Cheyenne Wells, Burlington, Hugo, Springfield, La Junta, Springfield, Lamar, Eads, La Veta Pass, Trinidad, Boone, and Las Animas.. Advisory in Effect: 11:00 AM MDT, Friday, March 31, 2023 to 8:00 PM MDT, Friday, April 29, 2022. Public Health Recommendations: If significant blowing dust is present and reducing visibility to less than 10 miles across a wide area, People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children in the affected area should reduce prolonged or heavy indoor and outdoor exertion. Outlook: Strong and gusty winds will produce areas of blowing dust on Friday. The threat for blowing dust will gradually diminish by Friday evening. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: Increasing likelihood of respiratory symptoms in sensitive individuals, aggravation of heart or lung disease and premature mortality in people with cardiopulmonary disease and older adults. People with heart or lung disease, older adults, and children should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.

area.areaDesc: Elbert; Larimer; Lincoln; Logan; Morgan; Phillips; Sedgwick; Washington; Weld
